most_active_tickets.title: Adding a script language to the supported languages
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service

common_issues.title: Pieces Users Report Issues and Request Features
common_issues.description: Users report various issues like app launch failures, download errors, and feature requests for language support. The Pieces team actively triages, requests information, and works towards solutions while keeping users informed.

related_issues.title: Adding a script language to the supported languages
related_issues.text:
Adding a script language to the supported languages ### Discussed in https://github.com/pieces-app/support/discussions/1
Originally posted by **ddasberg** January 21, 2025 Is it possible to add a script language to the supported languages? If so, what kind of files or information are necessary? We have develeoped a script-language for database-applications for Windows named "CARA". Our complete Windows-ERP-System has been written in CARA. It would be nice to have Pieces-support for the language.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key points raised:** * User @ddasberg created an issue requesting support. * The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team. * The user was provided with helpful resources while they waited for a follow-up. * @mark-at-pieces, a member of the Pieces team, responded to the user. **Problems identified:** * The user's issue required support from the Pieces team. * The user needed information about the status of their issue. **Solutions proposed/implemented:** * The issue was triaged and routed to the appropriate team member. * The user was provided with helpful resources. * @mark-at-pieces responded to the user and confirmed that the feature request had been added to the language support backlog. **Current status/outcome:** * The issue is being addressed by the Pieces team. * The user is waiting for an update on the status of their request. **Additional notes:** * The conversation occurred on January 21, 2025. * The specific details of the user's request and the proposed solution are not available in the conversation excerpt.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
##  GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: Pieces Desktop App won't launch 

**Key Points:**

* ThemePark reported an issue with the Pieces Desktop App not launching.
* Mack-at-pieces confirmed the issue and requested additional information for troubleshooting.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces Desktop App is unable to launch on ThemePark's Windows machine.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack-at-pieces requested information about ThemePark's Windows version and installation status of PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The conversation is ongoing and a solution has not yet been implemented. Mack-at-pieces is awaiting further information from ThemePark to diagnose the issue.


**Additional notes:**

* The bot mentioned some related issues and helpful resources, which may be useful for ThemePark.

## Conversation Summary: Unable to Download Local LLMs

**Key Points:**

* User @AmanSingh766 reported an issue with downloading local LLMs in Pieces Copilot Service.
* The user received an exception: "Connection closed before full header was received..."
* The Pieces support bot triaged the issue and provided relevant resources.
* Mark from the Pieces team followed up with clarifying questions and requested support logs.

**Problems Identified:**

* User was unable to download local LLMs.
* The exact cause of the error was unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark requested support logs to diagnose the issue.
* He inquired about the frequency of the error.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is under investigation by the Pieces team.
* A definitive solution has not yet been implemented.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was directed to related issues and helpful resources.

**Overall, the conversation highlights a user's difficulty with downloading local LLMs and the Pieces team's ongoing efforts to resolve the issue.**

recommendations: **Investigate and address the root cause of app launch failures and download errors:** This is crucial to improve user experience and reduce ticket volume related to these issues.
**Provide clear and concise documentation on language support:** This will help users understand how to use Pieces with their desired languages and potentially reduce support requests.
**Improve communication around background updates:** Users should be informed about background updates and how to manage them to avoid unexpected dialog boxes or interruptions.

**Investigate and resolve the "Connection closed before full header was received" error:** This error seems to be preventing users from downloading local LLMs, impacting the functionality of Pieces Copilot Service.
**Consider implementing a more robust error handling and reporting mechanism:** This will help gather more detailed information about errors, making it easier to diagnose and fix issues effectively.
**Prioritize feature requests based on user demand and impact:** Addressing popular feature requests like adding support for more scripting languages can significantly improve user satisfaction.
